text: Daniel Bourke (1886 – 13 April 1952) was an Irish Fianna Fáil politician. A wagon builder before entering politics, he was first elected to Dáil Éireann as a Fianna Fáil Teachta Dála (TD) at the September 1927 general election for the Limerick constituency. He was re-elected at every subsequent general election up to 1951. He died in 1952 during the 14th Dáil, a by-election was held on 26 June 1952 which was won by John Carew of Fine Gael. He was Mayor of Limerick from 1936 until 1941.Limerick Leader, 27 November 1965 ==References== Category:1886 births Category:1952 deaths Category:Fianna Fáil TDs Category:Members of the 6th Dáil Category:Members of the 7th Dáil Category:Members of the 8th Dáil Category:Members of the 9th Dáil Category:Members of the 10th Dáil Category:Members of the 11th Dáil Category:Members of the 12th Dáil Category:Members of the 13th Dáil Category:Members of the 14th Dáil Category:Politicians from County Limerick Category:Mayors of Limerick (city)
title: Daniel Bourke
